executive_summary: The US loan brokers industry enjoyed significant revenue growth through much of the five years to 2024 as interest rates hit record lows in the early years and consumer confidence soared. Low interest rates offered in the period and increased consumer spending spurred demand for mortgage and nonmortgage loan brokerage services, resulting in a surge in revenue of 33.8% in 2020 alone. These interest rates have steadily risen after the pandemic, bringing back a compressed lending environment in the latter half of the period. Loan brokers also continue to contend with educated consumers attracted to the easy lending processes popularized by online lenders.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Home Purchases and Renovations Soar with More Time Being Spent at Home
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Low interest rates and increased disposable income during the pandemic resulted in a booming housing market and a staggering 33.8% jump in revenue in 2020. According to the National Association of Realtors, this accommodating lending market has led first-time homebuyers to account for nearly a third of all homebuyers in 2022. Loan brokers increased their focus on broking residential mortgages and home equity loans as consumers spent more on renovation projects than entertainment, dining out and traveling amid the COVID-19 pandemic's.
Historically, regulation has tempered industry revenue, as new regulation imposes more substantial compliance costs and operation changes that undercut revenue gains.
In recent years, many nontraditional lenders have entered the financing market. These include start-up and growing fintech companies, online lenders and even some retailers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Technological Change Emphasizes Focus on Cyber Security
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Financial change has swept the financial sector over the past decade and this isn't slowing down as consumers continue to demand safe, consistent and integrated online services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand for Loans Will Slack as Interest Rates Climb Higher
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Runaway inflation has forced the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates aggressively in the years since the pandemic.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Competition is Set to Threaten Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Competition is set to become even more intense in the future.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Deregulation Presents a Double-Edged Sword for Loan Brokers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The effect of the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief and Consumer Protection Act, passed in 2018, will be felt by loan brokers in the outlook period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Greater Use of Artificial Intelligence and Big Data
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Loan brokers will likely make greater use of artificial intelligence (AI) and big data in the coming years.

industry_definition: This industry comprises brokers who arrange loans, especially mortgages, by bringing borrowers and lenders together on a commission or fee basis.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Existing homeowners who use loan brokers to obtain mortgage loans, likely having more discretionary income to afford broker services.
First-time homebuyers who may use loan brokers due to being unfamiliar with the borrowing process and wanting assistance.
Other consumers who use loan brokers for non-home related loans and financial products.
Businesses that rely on loan brokers to obtain commercial and industrial mortgages for land, building purchases or renovations.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Residential Mortgages for Single Family Residences
products_and_services.product_description: Residential mortgages for financing the purchase or renovation of single family homes.
Residential mortgages for financing the purchase or renovation of multifamily residences.
Secured loans taken out by businesses to finance the purchase or renovation of buildings, land, or investment.
Executing orders on behalf of clients or for themselves in brokering and dealing activities.
Other financial products and services offered by loan brokers.
Loans that use the equity in a borrower's home as collateral for funding personal expenses.
Loans provided for financing the purchase of vehicles.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Residential Loan Originations Tempered by Higher Interest Rates
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Residential mortgages are directly tied to the interest rates set by the Federal Reserve.

business_locations.location_description: Loan brokers thrive in states with high housing costs, such as California.
Consumers looking for warm weather tend to gravitate toward the southeast. States such as Florida have a large amount of retirement and vacation homes.
The Mid-Atlantic is home to some of the most populous cities in the United States.
